name: Alam KulKul Boutique Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights and when we checked in, we were given a room next to their sewage system. (3101 - avoid) They came to spray with lots of room freshener but didn't help! When we ask to change rooms, got ourselves away from the sewage but still a room without much view and a worn bathroom.
reviews.title: It's OK

reviews.text: Breakfast was nice - they serve up until the very last customer leaves. We always come right at the end of the breakfast time so this is important.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay - No problems whatsoever
Hmmmm Wouldnt stay again
reviews.text: Location is far out although still in Legian/Kuta- hardly walking distance to restaurants/ shopping.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Probably will not stay again
reviews.title: Little piece of Paradise

likes.disliked: — Building works next door - seem set to continue for a few years yet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I along with my wife and two daughters stayed here for 4 nights and we liked this hotel very much. It has a real balinese touch. The staff is very friendly and always helpful.
reviews.title: A perfect Balinese Gem

reviews.text: One word: WOW. What a beautiful property. It was an oasis in the crazy city of Kuta. The place was immaculately clean. The rooms were simply decorated in a tropical style with crisp and clean white bedding. They were big and had a lanai. My room overlooked the small side pool. I checked out Kuta Beach for a day of sun tanning. After being hassled by sellers and buying crap just to get them to leave me alone, I spent subsequent days by the hotel pool.
reviews.title: Tropical Oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What I found funny was that there were no in-room safes. They have this cute little room that holds the safety deposit boxes. You ring the bell to get in, retrieve items from your box, and sign for them. Many people might find this inconvenient. For me, it was rather charming.
reviews.title: Really enjoyed it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was huge. Of course, I overdosed on papayas. There were strange choices - like soup and other food you would encounter at lunch or dinner. A friend later explained that it was an Asian style breakfast. You will not leave hungry.
reviews.title: average room ,great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was amazing. Unfortunately, I had to cut my stay short by a day to meet my partner in Singapore. The travel agent onsite changed my flight that morning to leave at noon. I didn't know if it would be possible, but she made it happen quickly and efficiently.
reviews.title: This is not Bali

reviews.text: This place was a little piece of heaven on earth. Although I wasn't that fond of Bali (save for the volcano), I wish I had the option to choose this boutique resort in every city.
reviews.title: A perfect balinese hotel!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite the hotel being a distance from Kuta centre about 15-20 minutes walk, the hotel's ambience was beautiful. We really enjoyed our honeymoon there and will definately stay with Alamkulkul again for our next trip. We got a room which was facing the swimming pool and the view was spectacular. Breakfast at the Bunga Kelapa Restaurant was breathtaking. Lots of variety of food available as well.Overall Thumbs UP~
reviews.title: Gorgeous & Memorable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a great little hotel located between Kuta and Legian. We stayed for four nights. On the first night we arrived and were given a room with no balcony / terrace, which was surprising as all of their rooms claim to have a balcony or terrace!! We complained and were upgraded to following day. The upgraded room was large and had an amazing bathroom, but with no door and perspex windows so you can see everything - not very private and you would need to know the peron you are sharing with very well!! The hotel is just across the road from the beach and has a great restuarant attached to it called "Papa Johns" which serves pizza and pasta at reasonable prices. On our second night we were invited to the sunset cocktail party which was free and you got lots of free cocktails and lovely nibbles to eat whilst watching the amazing sunset on Kuta beach. We had the breakfast option included and it was well worth it, there was a huge variety of food to cater for both western and asian tastes and the coffee was "illy" and very good. The swimming pools are quite small, but enough for a dip to cool you down. The Jamu Spa attached to the hotel is also excellent - i had an aromatherapy body massage - the theripists are well qualified and it is half the price of the UK!
reviews.title: A great little hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A word of warning... they are currently building a new hotel complex next door which is a building site. We did not get disturbed by any of the noise from the building works but it is not a pleasant view from the main pool. It is due to be finished next year.
reviews.title: Beautiful Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After being totally stuffed around by the Seaview Villas we were recommended to go to this property with a local travel agent who my wife had used before recommending the hotel. Got to say that we were really quite concerned but we had no choice and it was our honeymoon! Anyway to cut a really long story short, the property is great! Twio swimming pools so if you are looking to get a bit of privacy, its possible. Beautifully appointed rooms in a real balinese fashion located just so you feel you are a little secluded with out haviong to walk miles. Greart staff who are friendly with out being over familiar, a great breakfast. It is a little way out of the main Kuta area but it is right on the beach front so its a nice walk into the shopping area. Would recommed this property to anyone
reviews.title: AlamKulKul was lovely

likes.disliked: — The construction next door, however, it only affected the villas and not the rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at AlamKulKul for one week in the beginning of June 2008. We initially arrived to the hotel one day earlier to see if we could check in and they were more than helpful. The next day we were transferred to our allocated room where we booked a Holiday Package which included 4 days, 3 nights in an Alam room, buffet breakfast daily, 2 dinners (food only) at Bunga Kelapa Restaurant and Papa's Cafe for two people. Both onsite. 1.5 hours Papaya Body Polish at Jamu Spa for two people (the BEST massage I have ever had in my life!), also onsite. This costed $335 USD, extra nights charged at $80 per night. I suggest booking directly with the hotel. Email communication was prompt and extremely helpful.
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It’s unfortunate that we could only get two days out of the three in Feb 08 that we wanted in this nice and comfortable but small boutique hotel. We were certainly quite impressed with the hotel quality and its value for money. Upon arrival at the hotel, we were shown to a small room where the check-in desks were located. We were then given cool wash towels to refresh ourselves and welcome drink vouchers that you can redeem at their bar at any time. All the staff were quite polite and helpful throughout our stay.
reviews.title: Nice relaxing boutique hotel - we love it

likes.disliked: — Mosquitoes in room, no newspaper delivery to room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located on a one-way street, away from the main Kuta shopping area and across the road from the beach. Being away from the hustle and bustle, gives it a more secluded relaxing feel…very much a world on its own. A taxi trip into town is quite reasonable; about Rp15,000 (about US$2) each way. Alam Kulkul definitely has a Balinese feel to it, as there are lots of statues and potteries set out in its garden outside the rooms. The gardens have a few varieties of local tropical fruits which you are welcome to help yourself to, if they are ripe.
reviews.title: Loved KulKul and they treated us so great!

likes.disliked: — Location - not close to walk to stores etc

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our standard Alam room was located at the back of the complex, facing a small swimming pool and being on a ground floor had more of a resort-feel to it. I had a good time swimming in the pool, but unfortunately my partner couldn’t, due to ‘that time of the month’. The room was reasonable sized, slightly dark but well furnished with a comfortable king-sized bed. The concrete bathtub was slightly old but large enough for my partner and I. Mosquitoes are a bit of a problem in the room as the plants/gardens and the damp weather do tend to attract them. The room do have electric mosquitoes repellent but we ended up asking housekeeping for an insect spray which they gladly provided.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!!!
Just ok
reviews.text: We had a relaxing time in AlamKulkul and would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone who wants value for money, enjoy a boutique hotel with a Balinese feel but don’t mind the location.

We stayed at Alam KulKul for two nights on our way to southern Indonesia. They were so welcoming and when we first got there had a cake with "Happy Honeymoon" on it for us and the bathtub was filled with flowers in the shape of a heart! The service was great and the complimentary breakfast had a lot of variety. It is a relaxing atmosphere in the hotel with the two pools. We got a couples massage there, and added our free 15 minutes coupon (that they give you on check in) to it so it was a great 1 1/4 hour massage.
reviews.title: nice small cozy hotel

description: Across the road from Kuta beach and handy to some great shopping spots, AlamKulkul Boutique Resort Bali is a refreshing, unique and tropical getaway possessing the ambiance of a Balinese village. The boutique resort is newly refurbished and looking wonderful with a simple yet stylish entrance and lobby.
